comments.raw_text:
about:firefox should have similar functionality across our platforms.

On Mobile: about:firefox navigates to a window where you can check for updates, read a FAQ, find Support info, etc.

On Desktop (Aurora Mac): about:firefox doesn't go anywhere, at the short-term this should redirect to about:support or similar.  The empty screen is unexpected.

The larger issue is we should have a consistent set of interactions across all platforms for these "about:" pages.  Not the biggest issue, but a fit/polish item to keep in mind.

comments.raw_text: This isn't a core issue, right?  about:firefox makes no sense in Gecko proper; it needs to be an about module that Firefox hooks up.
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.text: This isn't a core issue, right?  about:firefox makes no sense in Gecko proper; it needs to be an about module that Firefox hooks up.

Not a core issue, just don't know where to track/file the concept.  If it's a bug on each component (Firefox, Fennec...TBD), then I can file those.  Just feels that workflows should be the same in all Mozilla *browsers*.

Now that I'm writing this, seems more like UX should drive the issue.  Thoughts?
